comments:
I synchonized my code with the repository in the "Team-Synchronize" perspective.
Everything works fine, but whenn i try to switch to java- or to
debug-perspective the left frame won?t be updated/refreshed.
For exampel, if i switch to java-perspective i normaly have the
packageExplorer-View.
But in this case i have the "dead" synchronize-view which doesn?t react to any
userinput.
The only way for me to get to the packageExplorer-view is to restart eclipse.
In M7 this error doesn?t occure.
Not sure if UI or Team.

I have seen similar behavior several times.  I don't think it is always 
related to switching between "Team-Synchronize" and "java" or "dubug" 
perspectives.  But it does always seem to occur while switching perspectives.

yes, working intensiv with eclipse 3.1RC2 shows that this behaviour isn?t
depending on "team-snychronize" but switching from it to another perspective is
the perfect way to reconstruct it !
Moving to UI since latest comment indicates that it is not just Synchronize

Created an attachment (id=23459)
error log

Here is an interesting log that I got when this situation occurs.

Is there anything that went into RC3 that could have fixed this?  I was 
reproducing this bug on a regular basis until I moved to RC3.  Ever since I 
upgraded to RC3 I have not been able to reproduce.

Created an attachment (id=26913)
Resource perspective depends on JDT

An eclipse configuration that doesn't include the JDT (e.g. just the CDT) will
issue an error when opening the Resource perspective. The log file indicates
that there is a dependency on the JDT class org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer.
If the dependency is OK, then the error should be caught and the platform
should remain silent. I am using the Eclipse Platform:
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050627-1435

(From update of attachment 26913)
